intro: Pilosella schultesii subsp. schultziorum, commonly known as the Schultes' pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is distinguished by its dense, white to pale yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive, woolly appearance.
